thread.title: 6 places to visit near Jacksonville this Halloween
thread.title_full: 6 places to visit near Jacksonville this Halloween | Examiner.com

author: Amber Whitehead
title: 6 places to visit near Jacksonville this Halloween
text:
6 places to visit this Halloween near Jacksonville Amber Whitehead Halloween is just a couple of weeks away and some of you may be looking for places to go. There is plenty of Fall fun to be had near Jacksonville. Here are 6 fun events for all different ages.
October 28th head on out for Family Fright Night where you will find a family/group scavenger hunt and costume contest. The event begins at 5PM. There will also be a pumpkin bake off, fall games and lots more. 6430 Southpoint Parkway Jacksonville Florida
Take the family and hunt for skeletons. The Great St. Augustine Skeleton Hunt put on by Ripley's Believe it Or Not is happening now until October 31. Try and find all 11 skeletons hid around St. Augustine. All skeletons are visible from the street and located near the Ripley's red train route. Ripley's Believe It or Not will be the place to be on Halloween night. The fun starts at 5:30 pm with an "all aboard!" for the Trick or Treat Train. Ripley's Red Train will stop at four locations where kids can collect candy. After that, there's a stop at Bayfront Mini Golf for a round of "Ghoulie Golf", games, candy and prizes. Then at 7:00 pm, there will be a costume contest and special outdoor showing of "Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit" at the City Municipal Marina behind the mini golf course. After the movie, the train will take everyone back to Ripley's. The cost for all this is just $9 for adults and $5 for children ages 3 and up.
October 23 to 31st head to Kirby Family Farms for the Lost Railroad . The Lost Railroad is not for children under 13 years of age. Climb aboard the Historical 1800â€™s Locomotive & Railroad, and pray the Zombie corpses of the lost Carnies don't find the train as you journey through the darkness. Tickets are available for $20 in advance online or $25 at the gate.
October 29th head to Gainesville for Ghouls, Goblins and Greeks. A fun filled night with your kids on sorority row. (It's Awesome! ) There will be 16 sorority houses participating with fun , games and don't forget the candy. The event is 5-8 PM and is FREE. Head on over for the fun at Sorority Row, located on East and West Panhellenic Dr., between 8th and 9th Ave. Gainesville, FL 32601.
October 24th 6-10 PM be prepared to be scared! Get ready for a hike and costume dance at Gold Head State Park in Keystone Heights. $5 per person for both the hike and ball, food and drinks will also be on sale after the hike. Mike Roess Gold Head Branch State Park , is located at 6239 State Road 21, Keystone Heights, Florida, 32656.
Celebrate Spooktacular at the Jacksonville Zoo October 16-18, 23-25, and 28-31 from 6:30 to 10PM Gates close at 9. Nonmembers the cost is $10 each and you will find all kinds of jack- o - lanterns, candy exhibits set up through the zoo, a "Charlie Brown" pumpkin patch and more. Jacksonville Zoo is at 370 Zoo Pkwy, Jacksonville, FL 32218
Have fun!
